entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 3:15AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Friday into Saturday... Elevated surf will develop Friday and continue into Saturday. Northwest winds of 20 to 30 mph are expected Friday into Saturday causing waves to wash up near the top of the beach. Minor beach erosion may occur and belongings left on the beach could wash away.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 3:14AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Through Friday... Elevated surf will continue into Friday. Southwest to west winds of 20 to 35 mph will continue today, then turn northerly tonight and Friday. This will cause waves to wash near the top of the beach. Minor beach erosion may occur and belongings left on the beach could wash away.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 3:14AM AKDT by NWS

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 3:14AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Winds Expected Friday Night And Saturday... West winds gusting over 40 mph are expected late Friday night into Saturday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 3:14AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Significant Snow Possible Fri Night and Saturday... A cold front will move east across the North Slope Friday night and Saturday will bring mixed rain and snow. Areas above 2000 feet could have 3-6 inches of snow Friday night and Saturday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northeastern Brooks Range; Northwestern Brooks Range
